results.title: Say it with words
results.brief_description: There are important differences between writing in private and speaking in public. This program demonstrates the following skills: preparing the speech, rehearsal, and the correct use of visual aids. A humorous program with Judy McBride, David Argue, Tracy Harvey and Mark Little.

results.title: Say bow-wow
results.creator_credit: Gil Brealey, Kip Porteous and Australian Broadcasting Commission
results.brief_description: A satire on non-conformity and artistic pretentiousness. A director is ridiculed at a script conference and humiliated in a street chase. Suddenly he becomes a clever, and therefore, famous dog. But despite initial celebration he soon incurs public displeasure, is chased through the streets and meets final indignities of the dog-catchers net and van.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Gil Brealey, Kip Porteous and Australian Broadcasting Commission

results.title: Say a prayer for me: the chaplins of the Vietnam war
results.creator_credit: Andrew Williams, Don Keyes and Australia. Army
results.brief_description: A documentary about the Australian military chaplains who served in Vietnam. Combining archival footage with interviews with chaplains and soldiers, the film considers the issues they were forced to confront on a daily basis. The underlying theme is the evident humanity of the chaplains, who had to deal with their own trauma while providing support for soldiers emotionally and physically torn apart by the brutality of the Vietnam war. The film also discuss the negative reactions the military chaplains faced from other clergy when they returned from Vietnam due to their involvement in an unpopular war.
results.title_for_label: Say a prayer for me: the chaplins of the Vietnam war

results.title: Saws
results.brief_description:
Episode of Series “Basic woodwork”.

results.title: Saving the garden crop
results.creator_credit: Jack Tilles, Walter Scott and Chester Lindstrom
results.brief_description: Detailed description of what to do with various types of vegetables which you grow in your own home garden and may have too many to use or give away immediately, and want to sort for later use. Onions, which need to be kept dry, can be stored in the attic; when beans have been dried they are stored in glass jars or cans; for storing apples, squash, cabbage, pumpkin and root vegetables, detailed instructions are given and demonstrated in this film.

results.title: Saving Grace
results.creator_credit: Costa Botes, Larry Parr, Kahukura Films and New Zealand Film Commission
results.brief_description: When Grace, a homeless teenager whose emotional stability was shattered when her mother committed suicide, meets Gerald, an unemployed, compassionate carpenter, a tentative relationship develops between the two. Grace moves into Gerald’s house and their budding friendship gradually turns into love. Yet everything changes when Gerald reveals a stunning and incomprehensible secret— that he is the Son of God.

results.title: Save those teeth
results.brief_description: Emphasises the importance of proper cleansing and care of teeth and illustrates how teeth are affected by excessive use of refined sugar. Identifies the kind of bacteria that change sugar to acid in the mouth. Demonstrates the use of sodium fluoride solution in the prevention of tooth decay and prescribes specific rules to be followed in the care of teeth.

results.title: Save this life
results.brief_description: The back-pressure arm-lift method of artificial respiration is shown by an instruction to Boy Scouts The correct position in which to place the patent and the position of the rescuer in relation to the patient is explained and the slow rhythmic action required is demonstrated with step-by-step commentary .

results.title: Save the soil
results.creator_credit: Raymond Evans and Division of Motion Pictures Extension Service
results.brief_description: A general discussion on the problem of soil conservation. Various ways in which soil can be conserved and protected are demonstrated, including: terracing; cover-cropping to prevent erosion; crop rotation; use of manures and commercial fertilizers.
